# Teaching at UofSC

## Current Courses

-   BIOL 301 Ecology and Evolution Lecture (Jan 2026-Present)

    -   Course Description: Concepts of evolution, populations, and population interactions; communities and ecosystems.

## Past Courses

-   BIOL 102L Biological Principles II Laboratory (Aug-Dec 2023)

    -   Course Description: Experimental examination of structure and function of plant and animal systems, biodiversity, ecology.

-   BIOL 301L Ecology and Evolution Laboratory (Jan 2024-May 2025)

    -   Course Description: Experiments, exercises, and demonstrations.

## Teaching Enrichment Opportunities

I have been taking advantage of programs and short courses offered through the University of South Carolina [Center for Teaching Excellence.](https://sc.edu/about/offices_and_divisions/cte/index.php)

1.  [Preparing Future Faculty Program](https://sc.edu/about/offices_and_divisions/cte/graduate_teaching_assistants/preparing_future_faculty/) - December 2025-Present

    -   The Preparing Future Faculty (PFF) program is a professional development opportunity that provides assistance to graduate students and post-docs who want to become faculty members at the college level. PFF is a national program established by the Council of Graduate Schools, the Association of American Colleges and Universities, the Pew Charitable Trust and the National Science Foundation.

2.  [Foster Student Learning through Effective Teaching - Short Course](https://sc.edu/about/offices_and_divisions/cte/programs/short_courses/effective_teaching/) - Jan 2026 - Feb 2026
